content: Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Sep 2018Can anyone recommend any credit or debit cards that can be used together with cardup or ipaymy that will offer enough cashback or miles to be worth the transaction fees?I'm renting premises to carry out my business. Monthly rental is $5000. The landlord does not accept credit cards.  Thank you.4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Kenichi Xi, nᴉʍ oʇ dǝnᴉʇsǝd 不能说的秘密 at Tag Team with Gabriel ThamLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 21 Sep 20181) Cardup you can choose between Personal or Business 2) ipaymy  focus on SME which is Business Account​Both requires a tx fee of 2.6% for each tx.​For card recommendation, you can refer to their website for more information.​You can use the calculator available to calculate the cashback or milespoint for example ​https://cardup.co/homes/cashback_calculator​You have to dyodd whether the credit card you are holding is more beneficial after the tx fee.​Hope my reply helps.If you feel this reply have Quality, please upvote and check other Quality Reply.​https://seedly.sg/profile/a-kenichi-xiThank you.0 comments1

Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 20 Sep 2018I think a lot of banks have shut down the CardUp and ipaymy ​i am currently using Citi Pretige with card up for income tax0 comments1

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 Sep 2018BOC Family. You need to do a basic Excel to calculate and compare. So far it's ok. ​Check out SGBB ways for more tips :​http://www.sgbudgetbabe.com/search?q=Cardup&m=10 comments1
Nicholas ChanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 22 Sep 2018Use multiple credit cards! With cardup, you can split your bill payment, max out online cashback cards like boc, then go for miles! 0 comments0
